abstract: After an auction that lasted just four minutes, the Russian state oil company Rosneft won the bidding Tuesday for assets of the bankrupt company Yukos, further tightening the Kremlin’s control of energy industries in Russia. In the auction, Rosneft bid against a joint venture of BP and Russian partners, called TNK-BP, for 9.44 percent of Rosneft’s own stock, which Yukos had acquired in a swap before its bankruptcy.
lead_paragraph: After an auction that lasted just four minutes, the Russian state oil company Rosneft won the bidding Tuesday for assets of the bankrupt company Yukos, further tightening the Kremlin’s control of energy industries in Russia. In the auction, Rosneft bid against a joint venture of BP and Russian partners, called TNK-BP, for 9.44 percent of Rosneft’s own stock, which Yukos had acquired in a swap before its bankruptcy.

headline.main: Rosneft Wins Yukos Stake in 4-Minute Sale
